The company is going through a period of trying to figure out how to be a modern organization, from an operational standpoint (thanks to a kick in the nether regions by Amazon) . Currently, the entire organization is run off of MS Excel. So if you've worked in an industry such as medical, CPG, etc. and come to work for Kroger, it will be like stepping back into the 1990s. I hope that this won't be the case in a couple of years, if the modernization efforts take hold.
cons:
Kroger is very siloed (division to division). There are several functions that perform the same scope of work, however, don't talk to each other. Thus lose out on potential gains that could be realized by leveraging the scale of the organization and commonality in disciplines.
Advice to Management
Loose all the various banners. Be one "Kroger". This will help to eliminate the silo culture that is so pervasive and limiting there. All your major competitors are single-branded. Take the hint, step into the present. You won't loose customers.

pros: My first 9 years, starting in 2008 as a Kroger Pharmacist were fantastic. Management motivated me to be the best I can by focusing on patient care. The pharmacy grew fiscally yearly.
cons:
Retail pharmacy changed in 2016, as the pharmacist market became saturated the focus was taken off patient care and pharmacist hours and salaries were cut. Still Kroger demanded the same production from employees. People left Kroger including everyone that I worked with at Kroger that made the pharmacy what it was. The pharmacy is now not even a fraction of what it used to be.

You have your reasons.
